column4: has anyone downloaded the new version of opera? 9.5? I'm confused as to which version to get, you can see them all here; http://snapshot.opera.com/unix/9.50-Alpha-1/
do you know your machine type?
probably ppc-linux, intel-linux, or x86_64-linux
well i have an amd processor, if there's a command i can put into terminal i can find out
uname -a
hmmm, didn't really give me a good answer. i686? lol
32-bit
i686 happens to be called intel there so use intel-linux
cat /proc/cpuinfo says amd 64 processor
you're running 32-bit ubuntu
you need not your CPU's arch but your OS's architecture from uname -a
ahhh i see
so intel-linux is the one to download then?
amd64 CPUs (as you can see) can run both 32 and 64bit OS
ya
http://snapshot.opera.com/unix/9.50-Alpha-1/intel-linux/ is the new page after clicking intel-linux, what does 5-6-shared mean?
then there appears to be many options there.  i would choose the latest version (.10) and static.  static reduces problems running the program on a system with a lot of libraries.
with shared you're taking a chance that your system has what opera needs.  static ensures that library X is included in Opera itself so there are no problems
hmm, so opera-9.50-20070903.10-static-qt.i386-1567.tar.gz ?
right
ya
actually 98% of people will probably download what you are (for ubuntu)
ahhh i see
